</style>

    DM.later('bundle', function(){
        if (DM.Rotator) DM.Rotator.initMiniCarouselExt("mini-carousel-wrapper", "6", "4");

      <div id="js-article-text" class="article-text wide  heading-tag-switch">
            <h1>How does capital gains tax work? When you have to pay and what the CGT rates and allowances are for second homeowners, landlords and investors?</h1><p class="author-section byline-plain">By <a href="/home/search.html?s=&amp;authornamef=Tanya+Jefferies+for+Thisismoney.co.uk" class="author">Tanya Jefferies for Thisismoney.co.uk</a> <a rel="nofollow noreferrer noopener" target="_blank" href="https://twitter.com/intent/follow?screen_name=Tanya_Jefferies&amp;tw_p=followbutton" class="twitter-follow-author"><span class="follow-author"></span></a> </p><p class="byline-section"><span class="article-timestamp article-timestamp-updated"> <span class="article-timestamp-label">Updated:</span> <time datetime="2023-11-03T09:07:30+0000"> 09:07 GMT, 3 November 2023 </time> </span> </p><p></p><div id="articleIconLinksContainer"> <ul> <li class="share-facebook-long"></li> <li class="share-fbmessenger"> <a class="js-tl" rel=""></a> </li> <li class="share-whatsapp"></li> <li class="share-twitter"></li> <li class="share-flipboard"> <a class="js-tl" rel=""></a> </li> <li class="share-email"> <a rel="nofollow noreferrer noopener" target="_blank" href="mailto:?subject=Read this: How does capital gains tax work? When you have to pay and what the CGT rates and allowances are for second homeowners, landlords and investors?&amp;body=How%20does%20capital%20gains%20tax%20work%3F%20When%20you%20have%20to%20pay%20and%20what%20the%20CGT%20rates%20and%20allowances%20are%20for%20second%20homeowners%2C%20landlords%20and%20investors%3F%0A%0ARadical%20cuts%20to%20the%20Capital%20Gains%20Tax%20allowance%20by%20the%20Government%20make%20it%20inevitable%20that%20many%20more%20people%20will%20have%20to%20pay%20it%20in%20future.%0A%0Ahttps%3A%2F%2Fwww.thisismoney.co.uk%2Fmoney%2Finvesting%2Farticle-11469587%2FWhat-capital-gains-tax-it.html%3Fito%3Demail_share_article-top%0A%0A%0A%0A"> <span class="wai">e-mail</span> </a> </li> <li data-anchor="tl" data-twitter-status=" https://thismon.ee/a/11469587 via @ThisIsMoney" data-formatted-headline="What is capital gains tax and how much will I pay?" data-hide-email="true" data-article-id="11469587" data-article-channel-follow-button="ThisIsMoney" data-is-channel="false" id="shareLinkTop" class="share-icons" data-placement="top" data-url="https://www.thisismoney.co.uk/money/investing/article-11469587/What-capital-gains-tax-it.html"> <a class="js-sl share-link email_share_article-top" href="#socialLinks"></a> </li> </ul> <div class="share-count"> <b>21</b> <span>shares</span> </div> <a class="comments-count home" href="/money/investing/article-11469587/What-capital-gains-tax-it.html#comments"> <span></span> <p class="count-number"> 77</p> <p class="count-text">View <br /> comments</p> </a> </div> <!-- ad: https://mads.dailymail.co.uk/v8/fr/money/moneyinvesting/article/other/para_top.html --> <p></p><!-- CWV --><!--[if !IE]><!--> <link href="https://scripts.dailymail.co.uk/static/mol-fe/static/mol-fe-async-bundle/8.1.0/articleDefer.css" media="all" rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" /> <!--<![endif]--> <!--[if IE]>

 }
</script> <!-- CWV --><div itemprop="articleBody"><p class="mol-para-with-font">Capital gains tax is levied on profits from assets ranging from shares to second homes, buy-to-let properties and personal possessions.</p><p class="mol-para-with-font">It is traditionally applied at lower rates than income tax because the assets in question tend to be those on which people are taking a risk - whether an entrepreneurial one, or via investments held outside Isas and pensions.</p><p class="mol-para-with-font">Employment income and savings interest are more guaranteed, and so taxed differently and more heavily.</p><div class="artSplitter mol-img-group" style="style"> <div class="mol-img"> <div class="image-wrap"> <img id="i-64865ef578e5ce54" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIAAAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAAALAAAAAABAAEAAAIBRAA7" data-src="https://i.dailymail.co.uk/1s/2022/11/25/14/64645627-0-image-m-4_1669387070183.jpg" height="366" width="634" alt="Capital gains tax is levied on assets ranging from shares to second homes, buy-to-lets and personal possessions" class="blkBorder img-share" style="max-width:100%" /> </div> <noscript> <img id="i-64865ef578e5ce54" src="https://i.dailymail.co.uk/1s/2022/11/25/14/64645627-0-image-m-4_1669387070183.jpg" height="366" width="634" alt="Capital gains tax is levied on assets ranging from shares to second homes, buy-to-lets and personal possessions" class="blkBorder img-share" /> </noscript> </div> <p class="imageCaption">Capital gains tax is levied on assets ranging from shares to second homes, buy-to-lets and personal possessions</p></div><p class="mol-para-with-font">Your main home that you live in, known as your Principal Private Residence, is exempt from CGT. That, plus an annual tax-free allowance that until last April was £12,300, has meant CGT is typically levied on wealthier taxpayers.</p><p class="mol-para-with-font">However, radical cuts to the CGT allowance by the Government make it inevitable that many more people will have to pay it in future. </p><div><div data-track-module="am-related_carousel^related_carousel" data-track-selector=".rotator-panels a:not([class*=external])" data-dm-rotator-rotate="false" data-track-pos="static" data-dm-rotator-auto-init="" id="p-16" class="related-carousel with-fb-or-tw money" data-dm-rotator-active-class="active" data-dm-rotator-page-count="1.0" data-dm-social-article-auto-init="" data-dm-rotator-page-size="1"> <div class="rotator bdrcc"> <div class="rotator-title"> <h2>RELATED ARTICLES</h2> <ul class="rotator-pages link-xocc"> <li class="rotator-prev"><a href="#" data-page="prev">Previous</a></li> <li><a href="#" data-page="1">1</a></li> <li class="rotator-next"><a href="#" data-page="next">Next</a></li> </ul> </div> <ul class="rotator-panels link-bogr1 linkro-ccox"> <li> <a href="/money/markets/article-11450171/Wealth-taxes-middle-class-rake-130bn.html"> <img src="https://i.dailymail.co.uk/1s/2022/11/20/19/64751517-0-image-m-22_1668973165295.jpg" width="62" height="60" /> <span>A wealth tax by another name? Inheritance tax and CGT raid...</span> </a> <a href="/money/investing/article-11439335/Investors-hammered-dividend-CGT-allowances-slashed.html"> <img src="https://i.dailymail.co.uk/1s/2022/11/17/13/64111471-0-image-a-6_1668690668574.jpg" width="62" height="60" /> <span>Chancellor hammers small investors! Dividend tax-free limit...</span> </a> <a href="/money/article-11435831/Autumn-Statement-Key-tax-bills-pensions-announcements-Chancellor-Jeremy-Hunt.html"> <img src="https://i.dailymail.co.uk/1s/2022/11/17/08/64615755-0-image-a-6_1668673584551.jpg" width="62" height="60" /> <span>The Autumn Statement tax raid: From income tax, to CGT,...</span> </a> <a href="/money/buytolet/article-11439549/Autumn-Statement-capital-gains-tax-changes-mean-landlords-pay-2-600-selling-properties.html"> <img src="https://i.dailymail.co.uk/1s/2022/11/17/13/64199067-0-image-a-7_1668692060221.jpg" width="62" height="60" /> <span>Average buy-to-let landlord selling up will lose £2,600 more...</span> </a> </li> </ul> </div> <div class="fb"> <h2>Share this article</h2> <div class="share"><span class="wai">Share</span></div> <div class="count"><span>21</span> shares</div> </div> </div> <div class="related-partners money"> <div class="bdrcc"> <h2> HOW THIS IS MONEY CAN HELP </h2> <ul class="link-xogr1 linkro-ccox cleared"> <li class="full-width"> <a href="https://itunes.apple.com/gb/podcast/this-is-money-show/id979600898?mt=2" rel="nofollow"> <span>What you need to know each week: Listen to the This is Money podcast</span> </a> </li> </ul> </div> </div> </div><h2 class="mol-para-with-font mol-style-subhead">Capital gains tax is levied on your profits</h2><p class="mol-para-with-font">Capital gains tax is paid on the <span class="mol-style-bold">profits</span> when you sell an asset - what it sells for, less what you paid for it or it was worth when acquired.</p><p class="mol-para-with-font">Depending on the asset there are reliefs available and each person has a capital gains tax allowance, which is currently £6,000, to offset against their gains.</p><div class="art-ins mol-factbox floatRHS money" data-version="2" id="mol-41897980-7095-11ed-ae63-ddbc6983cb5a" data-permabox-url="https://www.thisismoney.co.uk/money/investing/article-11469587/What-capital-gains-tax-it.html"> <h3 class="mol-factbox-title">Got a tax question? </h3> <div class="ins cleared mol-factbox-body"> <p class="mol-para-with-font">Heather Rogers, founder and owner of Aston Accountancy, is This is Money's tax columnist.</p><p class="mol-para-with-font">She can answer your questions on any tax topic - tax codes, inheritance tax, income tax, capital gains tax, and much more.</p><p class="mol-para-with-font">You can write to Heather at <a style="font-weight: bold;" class="class" rel="nofollow noreferrer noopener" target="_self" href="mailto:taxquestions@thisismoney.co.uk">taxquestions@thisismoney.co.uk</a>.</p></div><div data-swipe-article="false"><!- - ad: https://mads.dailymail.co.uk/v8/fr/money/moneyinvesting/article/other/mpu_factbox.html?id=mpu_factbox_1 - ->
</div> </div><p class="mol-para-with-font">But the CGT tax-free allowance will be slashed again to £3,000 in April 2024.</p><p class="mol-para-with-font"><a style="font-weight: bold;" class="class" href="/money/investing/article-11439335/Investors-hammered-dividend-CGT-allowances-slashed.html" target="_self"></a>'If an asset was transferred to you as a gift, then the value at transfer will be the valuation for acquisition,' says This is Money's tax expert Heather Rogers.</p><p class="mol-para-with-font">'When the asset is left to you through a will, then the probate value will be the value you are deemed to have acquired it for.'</p><p class="mol-para-with-font">Rogers adds: 'You can deduct costs of acquisition and disposal if relevant - the estate agent's and solicitor's fees on sale, for example. You can also deduct costs where you have spent money and have added value to the asset.'</p><p class="mol-para-with-font">Regarding CGT rates, if you're a higher or additional rate taxpayer (40 per cent or 45 per cent respectively) the CGT rate is 28 per cent on gains from residential property and 20 per cent on gains from other chargeable assets.</p><p class="mol-para-with-font">For basic rate taxpayers (20 per cent), if your taxable gain plus your total taxable income fall within the basic income tax band of £12,571 to £50,270, the CGT rate is 18 per cent on residential property and 10 per cent on other gains.</p><p class="mol-para-with-font">If the amount is higher, the CGT rate is 28 per cent on residential property and 20 per cent on other gains.</p><p class="mol-para-with-font">The Government has <a style="font-weight: bold;" class="class" rel="noreferrer noopener" target="_blank" href="https://www.gov.uk/capital-gains-tax/rates">more information on CGT rates here.</a></p><p class="mol-para-with-font">Rogers explains <a style="font-weight: bold;" class="class" href="/money/experts/article-11382075/CGT-use-32k-loss-house-sale-1989-cut-bill-now.html" target="_self">how to carry forward capital losses to offset them against capital gains here.</a></p><div class="moduleHalf"><div class="money item"> <div class="js-picture-swap picture-swap ccogr2 cleared" id="p-29"> <h3>HEATHER ROGERS ANSWERS YOUR TAX QUESTIONS</h3> <img src="https://i.dailymail.co.uk/1s/2022/07/12/10/60167909-0-image-a-2_1657619451799.jpg" alt="" width="292" height="168" id="p-28-img" /> <ul class="link-ccow linkro-wocc"> <li> <a class="https://i.dailymail.co.uk/1s/2022/07/12/10/60167909-0-image-a-2_1657619451799.jpg| bold" href="/money/bills/article-11005223/How-good-accountant-Five-tips-tax-expert.html">How do you find a good accountant? Five tips on when to seek help, hiring the right firm and typical costs</a> </li> <li> <a class="https://i.dailymail.co.uk/1s/2023/10/09/15/76340265-0-image-a-2_1696863025254.jpg|" href="/money/experts/article-12611045/Avoid-inheritance-tax-moved-Australia.html">Will I avoid inheritance tax on my estate because I moved to Australia?</a> </li> <li> <a class="https://i.dailymail.co.uk/1s/2023/08/25/13/74717449-0-image-a-5_1692968042306.jpg| bold" href="/money/experts/article-12445411/Tax-free-shopping-travel-EU-countries.html">How does tax-free shopping now work when you travel to EU countries from Britain?</a> </li> <li> <a class="https://i.dailymail.co.uk/1s/2023/08/07/15/74046761-0-image-a-9_1691419482991.jpg|" href="/money/experts/article-12381401/Can-setting-trust-help-avoid-care-fees-HEATHER-ROGERS.html">Can setting up a trust help me avoid care fees?</a> </li> <li> <a class="https://i.dailymail.co.uk/1s/2023/07/05/14/72877599-0-image-a-3_1688565598996.jpg| bold" href="/money/experts/article-12267047/My-wife-fears-die-children-sell-property.html">My wife fears if I die first my children will sell our property against her wishes - can I protect her with a trust?</a> </li> </ul> <span class="tl"> </span> <span class="tr"> </span> <span class="bl"> </span> <span class="br"> </span> </div> <script type="text/javascript">
    DM.later('bundle', function(){
        DM.has("p-29", "pictureSwap");
    });
</script> </div> </div><p class="mol-para-with-font">And she looks at which types of <a style="font-weight: bold;" class="class" href="/money/experts/article-11275693/If-sell-letters-famous-rockstar-sent-pay-tax.html" target="_self">personal possessions, referred to in this context as 'chattels', are liable for CGT and which are exempt here.</a></p><h2 class="mol-para-with-font mol-style-subhead">What do buy-to-let landlords need to know about CGT?</h2><p class="mol-para-with-font">When you come to sell your buy-to-let property, there will be capital gains tax to pay on any profit.</p><p class="mol-para-with-font">It applies to any property which is not your main home - your Principal Private Residence - including private second homes as well.</p><p class="mol-para-with-font">CGT is levied at the rates explained above, but as gains are added to income to deliver a total amount this means that in practice most landlords making decent profits should pay the 28 per cent rate.</p><p class="mol-para-with-font">There are two reliefs you can get on your CGT bill, but they are both less generous than they once were.</p><p class="mol-para-with-font">First, there is a capital gains tax regime specifically for 'accidental' landlords, who once lived in a property before going on to let it out.</p><p class="mol-para-with-font">If a landlord rents out a property that was once their main home, capital gains tax only applies on the amount the home went up in value while they weren't living there.</p><p class="mol-para-with-font">Landlords can also add an extra nine months onto the amount of time they lived at the property - this is known as the 'final period exemption'.</p><p class="mol-para-with-font">As an example of how this works,  a landlord who has owned their property for 10 years and lived in it for two would<span style="font-size: 16px;"> be taxed on seven years and three months of capital gains – the 10 years, minus the two years residency plus the reduced nine months' relief.</span></p><div class="art-ins mol-factbox floatRHS money" data-version="2" id="mol-6d597fa0-6cd1-11ed-8e3e-c54b9300edff" data-permabox-url="https://www.thisismoney.co.uk/money/investing/article-11469587/What-capital-gains-tax-it.html"> <h3 class="mol-factbox-title">Ten tips for buy-to-let landlords </h3> <div class="ins cleared mol-factbox-body"> <p class="mol-para-with-font"> Read This is Money's <a style="font-weight: bold;" class="class" href="/money/mortgageshome/article-1596759/Ten-tips-buy-let.html" target="_self">guide to the essentials of property investment here</a>. </p></div><div data-swipe-article="false"><!- - ad: https://mads.dailymail.co.uk/v8/fr/money/moneyinvesting/article/other/mpu_factbox.html?id=mpu_factbox_2 - ->
</div> </div><p class="mol-para-with-font">Another key <a style="font-weight: bold;" class="class" rel="noreferrer noopener" target="_blank" href="https://www.gov.uk/tax-sell-home/let-out-part-of-home">CGT allowance to be aware of is 'lettings relief'.</a></p><p class="mol-para-with-font">When a landlord sells their former home after renting it out, up to £40,000 of their gain can be exempted from capital gains tax - but this now applies only if they lived in the property with their tenants.</p><p class="mol-para-with-font">Meanwhile, you can reduce your CGT bill by deducting some of the expenses associated with buying and managing a property.</p><p class="mol-para-with-font">You may also be able to offset losses on other property against your capital gains tax bill.</p><div class="moduleFull"><div class="money item"> <div class="shallow-ac double-width" id="p-40" data-track-module="llg-67921099^shallow_article_carousel" data-track-selector=".rotator-panels a"> <h2 class="bdrcc"><span class="wocc">THIS IS MONEY PODCAST</span> </h2> <div class="rotator"> <ul Will all these threats backfire?</span> </a> </li> <li> <a href="/money/podcast/article-11375105/Have-come-hard-buy-let-Money-podcast.html"> <img src="https://i.dailymail.co.uk/1s/2022/10/31/21/63683445-0-Cost_increase_Renting_is_costing_people_more_out_of_their_pay_pa-m-2_1667250293349.jpg" alt="" width="154" height="115" /> <span>Have we come down too hard on buy-to-let and hurt renters?</span> </a> </li> </ul> <div class="rotator-pages"> <div class="rotator-prev disabled"><i class="bg"> </i><i class="ico"> </i><a href="#" data-page="prev">Previous</a></div> <ul class="link-xogr3"> <li class="linkro-wocc"><a href="#" data-page="1">1</a></li> <li class="linkro-wocc"><a href="#" data-page="2">2</a></li> <li class="linkro-wocc"><a href="#" data-page="3">3</a></li> <li class="linkro-wocc"><a href="#" data-page="4">4</a></li> <li class="linkro-wocc"><a href="#" data-page="5">5</a></li> <li class="linkro-wocc"><a href="#" data-page="6">6</a></li> <li class="linkro-wocc"><a href="#" data-page="7">7</a></li> <li class="linkro-wocc"><a href="#" data-page="8">8</a></li> <li class="linkro-wocc"><a href="#" data-page="9">9</a></li> <li class="linkro-wocc"><a href="#" data-page="10">10</a></li> <li class="linkro-wocc"><a href="#" data-page="11">11</a></li> <li class="linkro-wocc"><a href="#" data-page="12">12</a></li> <li class="linkro-wocc"><a href="#" data-page="13">13</a></li> <li class="linkro-wocc"><a href="#" data-page="14">14</a></li> <li class="linkro-wocc"><a href="#" data-page="15">15</a></li> <li class="linkro-wocc"><a href="#" data-page="16">16</a></li> </ul> <div class="rotator-next"><i class="bg"> </i><i class="ico"> </i><a href="#" data-page="next">Next</a></div> </div> </div> </div> <script type="text/javascript">

    <div class="money item">
  <div class="js-picture-swap picture-swap ccogr2 cleared" id="p-1031">
  <h3>THE INVESTING SHOW</h3>
    <img src="https://i.dailymail.co.uk/1s/2023/03/30/22/49653171-0-Titan_VCT_invested_in_Depop_s_Series_B_round_back_in_2018_and_ex-m-20_1680211739358.jpg" alt="" width="292" height="168" id="p-1030-img" />

  <ul class="link-ccow linkro-wocc">
          <li>
      <a class="https://i.dailymail.co.uk/1s/2023/03/30/22/49653171-0-Titan_VCT_invested_in_Depop_s_Series_B_round_back_in_2018_and_ex-m-20_1680211739358.jpg| bold" href="/money/investingshow/article-11921991/What-need-know-investing-VCT-30-tax-break.html" >What you need to know about investing in a VCT and how to get the 30% tax break</a>
    </li>

          <li>
      <a class="https://i.dailymail.co.uk/1s/2023/03/08/16/68425907-0-image-m-1_1678293179580.jpg|" href="/money/investingshow/article-11836009/Blue-Whales-manager-ChatGPT-Meta-energy-stock-growth.html" >ChatGPT's threat to Google, where Meta went wrong and an energy stock for growth</a>
    </li>

          <li>
      <a class="https://i.dailymail.co.uk/1s/2023/02/20/13/67516545-0-image-m-1_1676899578314.jpg| bold" href="/money/investingshow/article-11772023/Is-real-estate-value-opportunity-TR-Propertys-Marcus-Phayre-Mudge.html" >Is commercial property now a great value opportunity?</a>
    </li>

          <li>
      <a class="https://i.dailymail.co.uk/1s/2023/02/02/18/67262407-0-image-a-15_1675361208181.jpg|" href="/money/investingshow/article-11706983/How-Impax-Environmental-Markets-invests-speak-Jon-Forster.html" >How Impax Environmental Markets invests in companies that can help the planet</a>
    </li>

          <li>
      <a class="https://i.dailymail.co.uk/1s/2022/12/02/21/65188339-0-image-m-16_1670016157287.jpg| bold" href="/money/investingshow/article-11496739/Will-investors-boost-inflation-falls-away-Investing-Show.html" >Will investors get a boost if inflation drops?</a>
